business.headline: India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

Bitcoin crosses $100,000 again, as US-UK trade deal lifts market moodThe announcement of a fresh trade deal between US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer helped lift market mood across sectors and gave crypto investors an added reason to feel positive.

YES Securities raises Paytm target to Rs 975 on profitability turnaround and surge in merchant lendingContribution margin rises to 56.1%, EBITDA turns positive before ESOP costs, and merchant loan volumes gain traction under DLG model.

Equity mutual fund inflows hit 1-year low in April amid tariff worries, says AMFIIndia's equity mutual fund inflows eased for a fourth month in April, dropping to Rs 242.69 billion, the weakest level in a year, reveals AMFI data.

Sensex tumbles 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was trading 722.62 points lower at 79,612.19 around 11:57 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 221.05 points to trade barely above 24,000. Most of the broader market indices also fell during the trading session as volatility surged due to the ongoing military escalations.

entertainment.headline: Paresh Rawal dismisses 'Akshay isn't friend' statement, calls him 'cool guy'Paresh Rawal says 'maatha kharab ho gaya' after the interview in which he called Akshay Kumar 'a colleague' and 'not a friend'. The actor now comes clean on the statement.

Kim Soo-hyun row: Actor hits back, files new lawsuit against Kim Sae-ron's familyKorean actor Kim Soo-hyun filed a lawsuit against YouTuber Kim Se-eui and Kim Sae-ron's family for spreading false information against the actor.

Single review: A timepass comedy without logic but delivers wholesome laughsReleased-Fri May 09, 2025'Single' movie review: Directed by Caarthick Raju, 'Single' is a slapstick comedy about a love triangle between Sree Vishnu, Ivana and Ketika Sharma. The film, although has an illogical plot, serves as a good timepass flick to watch and laugh in abandon.

Mahesh Babu's daughter Sitara's fan girl moment with Kendall JennerMahesh Babu's daughter Sitara Ghattamaneni recently bumped into international model Kendall Jenner. The two clicked selfies together, delighting fans across India.

The Royals review: A royal khichdi with ample hot bods but lacklustre chemistryReleased-Fri May 09, 2025'The Royals' offers a modern Indian fairy-tale set in Rajasthan, blending classic romance tropes with regal grandeur and contemporary twists. Despite its picturesque backdrop and strong performances, the show struggles to ignite the essential chemistry expected in a mushy romantic drama.
Rajamouli asks citizens to be cautious in wise note amid India-Pakistan tensionsFilmmaker SS Rajamouli praised the Indian Army and urged citizens to act responsibly amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Anushka Sharma posts proud note for Indian Army amid Indo-Pak tensions, Virat reactsAnushka Sharma called the Indian Armed Forces real 'heroes' in a note posted on Instagram, following India's precision strike against terrorist centres in Pakistan and PoK under the code-name Operation Sindoor. Her husband and cricketer, Virat Kohli, was among the first people to comment on the post.

Karan Kundrra to Krystle Dsouza: TV celebs extend support to Indian ArmyKaran Kundrra, Krystle Dsouza, Karan Veer Mehra, among other TV celebs who extended their support to the Indian army amid tensions with Pakistan.

Cancelled events to delayed releases: Impact of Indo-Pak tension on film industryThe recent terror attack in Pahalgam and subsequent Operation Sindoor have deeply affected the Indian entertainment industry, leading to cancellations of events and removal of Pakistani content from platforms. Film releases have also been impacted as the industry shows solidarity with the nation.

Priyanka Chopra cheers for husband Nick as he plays softball in Central Park. PicsPriyanka Chopra cheered for husband Nick Jonas at a Broadway League Softball Game in Central Park, days after their striking Met Gala 2025 appearance.

Raid 2 box office Day 8: India-Pak tensions affect Ajay Devgn's film's runWatching a film in a theatre is probably the last thing on people's minds right now, amid escalating tension between India and Pakistan. 'Raid 2' is the only Hindi film running in theatres attracting audiences. However, it is already seeing the impact of the escalation.

Abir Gulaal row: Ridhi Dogra says 'I stand with my country' on release postponement Actor Ridhi Dogra recently reacted to her film with Fawad Khan - 'Abir Gulaal' - facing an indefinite postponement amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

India comes first, art can wait: Kamal Haasan postpones Thug Life audio launchActor Kamal Haasan announced the postponement of 'Thug Life' audio launch amid India-Pakistan tensions. He wrote that India comes first.
Kusha Kapila's drastic transformation leaves fans puzzledActor Kusha Kapila's massive transformation has surprised fans. Fans speculated on cosmetic surgery or assumed denture procedures.

Neha Kakkar and husband Rohanpreet attend their driver's wedding. WatchSinger Neha Kakkar and Rohanpreet Singh were seen attending their driver's wedding in Mumbai, celebrating warmly with guests and the family. This heartfelt gesture video comes amid ongoing controversy surrounding Kakkar's Melbourne concert delay.

Rajkummar Rao's middle-class mojo, and making of the common man's kingRajkummar Rao's acting is deeply rooted in his middle-class background, making his characters feel incredibly real and relatable to the Indian audience. With his upcoming film 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' releasing soon, fans eagerly await to see yet another authentic portrayal that resonates like a familiar face from everyday life.

Chiranjeevi wants Ram Charan, Janhvi Kapoor for Jagadeka Veerudu sequelThe hit 1990 Telugu film 'Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari' re-released on May 9. Ahead of that, megastar Chiranjeevi expressed his wish to see his son Ram Charan and Sridevi's daughter Janhvi Kapoor in a potential sequel to the film.

Kangana Ranaut makes Hollywood debut with horror film Blessed be the Evil. DetailsKangana Ranaut has teamed up with Sylvester Stallone's daughter, Scarlett Rose Stallone, for a horror drama in Hollywood. The film will be presented to the buyers at the Cannes International Film Festival this year.

Malayalam actor Vinayakan arrested for creating nuisance under alcohol influenceMalayalam actor Vinayakan was arrested for causing a disturbance under the influence of alcohol at a hotel in Kerala. He was later released on bail after a case was registered under the Kerala Police Act.

general news.headline: 500 Pak drones targeted 24 cities in J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat: Army sourcesAccording to Army sources, Pakistan used drone swarms and targeted 24 cities in India on May 8. The Indian armed forces successfully thwarted the attack attempts and neutralised the drones.

LIVE: Armed forces document every anti-terror strike for transparency, say sourcesOperation Sindoor, India Pakistan Tension News Live Updates: On Thursday, Pakistan launched a series of missiles and drone attacks targeting several regions in India, including Jammu, Rajasthan, and Punjab. All incoming threats were successfully thwarted by India's defence forces, preventing large-scale damage and loss of life.
The provocation came just a day after India carried out precision strikes on terror camps located in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, in retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack. As tensions flared, Pakistan attempted to strike back by launching a barrage of missiles and deploying drones across the Line of Control and international borders.
India's response was swift and effective. The country's air defence systems intercepted at least eight incoming missiles, while fighter jets shot down a Pakistani F-16 and possibly two JF-17 aircraft.

Don't hoard food, fuel, Chandigarh orders as India-Pak tensions spark panic buyingThe Chandigarh administration has ordered all traders and stockists to declare their current stock to the Department of Food and Supplies within three days.

Baloch rebels see opportunity in Pak's adversity, hoist flags of liberationFierce attacks by Baloch rebels have shaken the Pakistani state, even as it is focused on the Indian front. Balochistan's provincial capital, Quetta, saw six attacks on Pakistani forces on Thursday. The Baloch people have replaced Pakistani flags with their own, and want to be recognised as an independent country, with a diplomatic mission in Delhi.

Pakistan's suicide attack on itself amid IMF meetEven as Pakistan is firing missiles and drones at Indian civilian and military infrastructure, the "establishment" of the almost-broke nation might be shooting itself in the foot. With a crucial IMF review meeting on loans to Pakistan today, Islamabad's war drums may drown out the jingle of the much-needed money.
US shuts down Pakistan's phone-a-friend bail out optionWith Washington stepping back and Pakistan's allies offering limited support, Islamabad is stuck between the proverbial rock and the hard place.

Centre empowers Army Chief to call out officers, enrollees of Territorial ArmyUnder a notification dated May 6, 2025, issued in accordance with Rule 33 of the Territorial Army Rules, 1948, the government has authorised the Army Chief to call out every officer and enroled personnel of the Territorial Army as needed, either for guard duties or for full embodiment to support and supplement the regular armed forces.

IPL suspended for a week, BCCI says nothing greater than nationIPL 2025 suspended: The Indian cricket board (BCCI) confirmed the suspension of the IPL for one week. In a statement, the board said that it would continue to follow the directives of the government and saluted the armed forces for leading the counter-strikes against Pakistan.

The smiles on Rajnath Singh, 3 service chiefs tell a story - India crushing PakThe meeting - attended by Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan, Chief of the Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi, Air Chief Marshal AP Singh, and Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi - came less than 24 hours after Pakistan launched a wave of drone and missile attacks along India's western border.

7 suspected Jaish terrorists killed while trying to infiltrate Jammu's SambaThe infiltration bid came on a day when India neutralised Pakistan military's attempt to hit military stations in Jammu, Pathankot, Udhampur and some other locations with missiles and drones as tensions soared between the two countries amid fears of a wider military conflict.

Pakistan Supreme Court strengthens army chief Asim Munir's handsEven as Pakistan reels after India's Operation Sindoor and the counterstrike after its aerial attack, its Supreme Court handed the Army, led by the unpopular General Asim Munir, a potent new weapon. Now, civilians can be tried in military courts in Pakistan. The judiciary has effectively approved a military crackdown on dissent, just when Munir needed it the most.
How Indian interceptors crushed Pak drones: Inside the air defence webThe night sky came to life with the roar of multiple interceptors from India that turned the Pakistani drones into duds.

Verified locations of Indian drone impact sites in PakistanTo filter facts from fiction, India Today has verified these claims using social media videos posted by locals, eyewitness accounts, satellite images, and reports in Pakistan's media.

Complete blackout in Jaisalmer, vehicle movement restricted until tomorrow morningThe development came hours after a bomb-like object was discovered in Jaisalmer on Friday morning, shortly after loud explosions rattled the city amid a series of Pakistani missile and drone attacks targeting military posts across the state.
Pechora unleashed: Inside the stealth killer that hunted Pak dronesThe Pechora, officially known as the S-125 Neva/Pechora, has been a mainstay of India's air defence network since the 1970s.

IPL 2025 suspended: Will BCCI eye Asia Cup window to reschedule tournament?With IPL 2025 suspended amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the BCCI is expected to explore a possible window later in the year to complete the remaining matches. An August-September window-potentially clashing with India's tour of Bangladesh and the Asia Cup-can be considered.

The psychological toll of a war-like situation on common manThe escalating tensions between India and Pakistan have left many feeling anxious and scared. Psychologists acknowledge the impact of such situations on mental health, but there are ways to cope.

We didn't tweet, says Pak as post extends begging bowl to world for more loansPakistan's Economic Affairs Ministry said its X account had been hacked after a post, appealing to international partners for more loans and helping to de-escalate rising tensions with India.

JF-17, HQ-9: Pak using China-made military assets to counter India's strikesPakistan's military arsenal, which is mostly China-made, comprises JF-17 and J-10 fighter jets and HQ-9 ground-to-air missile, all of which are facing the wrath of the far superior Indian artilleries.

RCB pacer Yash Dayal follows his process to reap rewards as death bowlerRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) medium pacer Yash Dayal has established himself as one of the top death-over bowlers in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Neeraj Chopra to compete at Ostrava Golden Spike 2025Neeraj Chopra is set to finally compete at the prestigious Ostrava Golden Spike 2025 in the Czech Republic on June 24, after missing the last two editions due to injury setbacks.

Manchester United set up Europa League final with Tottenham after thumping BilbaoManchester United thumped Athletic Bilbao 4-1 at Old Trafford to secure their spot in the final of the UEFA Europa League on Thursday, May 8. Tottenham Hotspur will face United in the final as they overcame Bodo/Glimt in the other semi-final clash.

Abhinav Bindra extends gratitude to Indian army as Pakistan escalates tensionsLegendary Indian shooter and Olympic gold medallist Abhinav Bindra has extended gratitude to the Indian armed forces amid the rising border tensions with Pakistan.

Evacuation without panic: How fans exited Dharamsala stadium after IPL match called offThe security officials did a splendid job during the evacuation process at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium after the PBKS vs DC game was called off on Thursday, May 7 after the attacks from Pakistan in various parts of India. A fan present at the game spoke to India Today about the evacuation process and how the incidents transpired on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
